name: Heart Attack (Myocardial Infarction)
description: A heart attack occurs when blood flow to the heart muscle is suddenly blocked, leading to tissue damage. It is a medical emergency.
symptoms: Pain in arms, neck, jaw, or back
causes: Blockage of coronary arteries due to plaque buildup or blood clots.
when_to_seek_help: Seek immediate emergency medical attention if chest pain or severe discomfort occurs.

assessment_questions.question: Are you experiencing chest pain or tightness?
Do you smoke cigarettes?

name: Cardiac Arrest
description: Cardiac arrest occurs when the heart suddenly stops beating, cutting off blood flow to the brain and other vital organs.
causes: Electrical malfunction of the heart leading to abnormal heart rhythm.
prevention_tips: Use of implantable defibrillators if advised
when_to_seek_help: Call emergency services immediately if a person collapses and is unresponsive.

assessment_questions.question: Have you ever been diagnosed with heart rhythm problems?

name: Heart Failure
description: A chronic condition in which the heart cannot pump enough blood to meet the body’s needs.
causes: Coronary artery disease, hypertension, damaged heart muscle.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience shortness of breath during routine activities?

name: Hypertension
description: A condition in which blood pressure remains consistently high over time.
causes: Genetics, lifestyle factors, excess salt intake.

assessment_questions.question: Have you been told you have high blood pressure before?

name: Coronary Artery Disease
description: A condition caused by narrowing of coronary arteries that supply blood to the heart.

assessment_questions.question: Do you feel chest pain during physical activity?

name: Lung Cancer
description: A cancer that begins in the lungs, most commonly associated with smoking.
causes: Long-term exposure to tobacco smoke or environmental pollutants.
when_to_seek_help: Cough lasting more than 3 weeks or coughing blood.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have a persistent cough lasting more than 3 weeks?
Do you currently smoke or have you smoked before?

name: Asthma
description: A chronic respiratory condition causing airway inflammation and narrowing.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience wheezing or breathing difficulty?

name: Bronchitis
description: Inflammation of the bronchial tubes leading to coughing and mucus production.

assessment_questions.question: Are you producing mucus with your cough?

name: Pneumonia
description: An infection that inflames air sacs in the lungs.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have fever with cough and chest pain?

name: Sinusitis
description: Inflammation of the sinuses causing facial pain and congestion.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have facial pain with nasal congestion?

name: COPD
description: A group of progressive lung diseases that block airflow.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience breathlessness during daily activities?

name: Allergic Rhinitis
description: An allergic reaction causing sneezing, congestion, and itchy eyes.
causes: Exposure to allergens like pollen or dust.

assessment_questions.question: Do your symptoms worsen during certain seasons?

name: Acid Reflux (GERD)
description: A digestive disorder where stomach acid frequently flows back into the esophagus, causing irritation.
symptoms: Regurgitation of food or sour liquid
causes: Weak lower esophageal sphincter allowing acid reflux.
prevention_tips: Do not lie down after eating
when_to_seek_help: Frequent or severe heartburn not relieved by medication.

assessment_questions.question: Do you frequently experience burning sensation in your chest after meals?

name: Gastritis
description: Inflammation of the stomach lining that can cause pain and nausea.
causes: Infection, excessive alcohol use, prolonged NSAID use.
when_to_seek_help: Persistent stomach pain or vomiting blood.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience stomach pain or nausea after eating?

name: Peptic Ulcer
description: Open sores that develop on the lining of the stomach or upper small intestine.
causes: Helicobacter pylori infection or long-term NSAID use.
when_to_seek_help: Severe abdominal pain or black stools.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience burning pain in your stomach that improves after eating?

name: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)
description: A common disorder affecting the large intestine, causing cramping and bowel changes.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience abdominal pain along with changes in bowel habits?

name: Jaundice
description: A condition characterized by yellowing of the skin and eyes due to high bilirubin levels.
causes: Liver disease, hepatitis, bile duct obstruction.
when_to_seek_help: Sudden yellowing of skin or eyes.

assessment_questions.question: Have you noticed yellowing of your skin or eyes?

name: Food Poisoning
description: Illness caused by eating contaminated food.
causes: Bacteria, viruses, or parasites in food.

assessment_questions.question: Did your symptoms start after eating outside or questionable food?

name: Constipation
description: A condition where bowel movements become infrequent or difficult.
when_to_seek_help: Persistent constipation lasting more than 2 weeks.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have fewer than three bowel movements per week?

name: Stroke
description: A medical emergency that occurs when blood supply to part of the brain is interrupted or reduced.
causes: Blocked or ruptured blood vessels in the brain.
when_to_seek_help: Immediate emergency medical attention is required.

assessment_questions.question: Have you experienced sudden weakness or numbness on one side of your body?

name: Migraine
description: A neurological condition characterized by intense, recurring headaches.
when_to_seek_help: Severe or frequent headaches disrupting daily life.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience severe headaches with nausea or light sensitivity?

name: Epilepsy
description: A neurological disorder characterized by recurrent seizures.

assessment_questions.question: Have you experienced repeated seizure episodes?

name: Parkinson’s Disease
description: A progressive nervous system disorder affecting movement.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience persistent tremors or muscle stiffness?

name: Alzheimer’s Disease
description: A progressive disorder that causes memory loss and cognitive decline.

assessment_questions.question: Have you noticed worsening memory problems over time?

name: Vertigo
description: A sensation of spinning or dizziness.

assessment_questions.question: Do you feel a spinning sensation when changing head position?

name: Dengue
description: A mosquito-borne viral infection causing high fever and body pain.

assessment_questions.question: Have you had a sudden high fever with severe body pain?

name: Malaria
description: A life-threatening disease transmitted through mosquito bites.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience fever episodes with chills and sweating?

name: Tuberculosis
description: A bacterial infection that primarily affects the lungs.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have a cough lasting more than two weeks with weight loss?

name: Typhoid Fever
description: A bacterial infection spread through contaminated food and water.

assessment_questions.question: Have you had prolonged fever with abdominal discomfort?

name: Cholera
description: An acute diarrheal disease caused by contaminated water.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have sudden severe watery diarrhea?

name: Hepatitis B
description: A viral infection that attacks the liver.

assessment_questions.question: Have you noticed yellowing of your eyes or skin with fatigue?

name: HIV/AIDS
description: A chronic condition caused by the human immunodeficiency virus that weakens the immune system.
when_to_seek_help: Recurrent infections or unexplained weight loss.

assessment_questions.question: Have you experienced frequent infections or unexplained weight loss?

name: Chickenpox
description: A highly contagious viral infection causing itchy rash and fever.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have an itchy blister-like rash with fever?

name: Back Pain
description: Pain or discomfort in the upper, middle, or lower back.
when_to_seek_help: Severe or persistent pain lasting more than a few weeks.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience persistent back pain that limits movement?

name: Sciatica
description: Pain radiating along the sciatic nerve from the lower back to the leg.
when_to_seek_help: Severe pain or weakness in leg.

assessment_questions.question: Does your pain radiate from the lower back to the leg?

name: Arthritis
description: Inflammation of one or more joints causing pain and stiffness.
causes: Joint wear and tear or autoimmune conditions.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience joint stiffness especially in the morning?

name: Osteoporosis
description: A condition characterized by weakened bones and increased fracture risk.
causes: Low bone density due to aging or hormonal changes.

assessment_questions.question: Have you experienced fractures from minor falls?

name: Gout
description: A form of arthritis characterized by sudden, severe joint pain.

assessment_questions.question: Have you had sudden severe pain in a joint, especially the big toe?

name: Fibromyalgia
description: A disorder characterized by widespread musculoskeletal pain and fatigue.
causes: Abnormal pain processing in the brain.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience widespread body pain lasting more than 3 months?

name: Type 2 Diabetes
description: A chronic condition affecting how the body processes blood sugar.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience excessive thirst and frequent urination?

name: Obesity
description: A condition involving excessive body fat that increases health risks.

assessment_questions.question: Have you experienced significant weight gain recently?

name: Thyroid Disorders
description: Conditions affecting thyroid hormone production.

assessment_questions.question: Have you noticed unexplained weight changes or fatigue?

name: Depression
description: A mood disorder causing persistent feelings of sadness and loss of interest.
when_to_seek_help: Thoughts of self-harm or inability to function daily.

assessment_questions.question: Have you been feeling persistently sad or hopeless for weeks?

name: Anxiety Disorder
description: A condition involving excessive fear, worry, or nervousness.

assessment_questions.question: Do you feel anxious or worried most days?

name: Insomnia
description: A sleep disorder characterized by difficulty falling or staying asleep.
when_to_seek_help: Persistent sleep problems affecting daily life.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have trouble falling or staying asleep most nights?

name: Acne
description: A skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become clogged with oil and dead skin cells.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have frequent pimples or clogged pores?

name: Eczema
description: A condition causing inflamed, itchy, and irritated skin.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience itchy, inflamed skin patches?

name: Psoriasis
description: An autoimmune condition causing rapid skin cell buildup.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have thick, scaly patches on your skin?

name: Skin Cancer (Melanoma)
description: A serious form of skin cancer that develops from pigment-producing cells.
when_to_seek_help: Changes in size, shape, or color of a mole.

assessment_questions.question: Have you noticed a mole changing in size, shape, or color?

name: Glaucoma
description: An eye condition that damages the optic nerve, often due to high eye pressure.
when_to_seek_help: Sudden vision changes or eye pain.

assessment_questions.question: Have you experienced gradual vision loss or eye pain?

name: Cataracts
description: Clouding of the eye lens leading to blurred vision.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have blurry vision or difficulty seeing at night?

name: Conjunctivitis
description: Inflammation of the conjunctiva, commonly known as pink eye.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have red, itchy eyes with discharge?

name: Breast Cancer
description: A cancer that forms in the cells of the breast.

assessment_questions.question: Have you noticed a new lump or change in your breast?

name: Colorectal Cancer
description: Cancer affecting the colon or rectum.

assessment_questions.question: Have you noticed blood in your stool or persistent bowel changes?

name: Prostate Cancer
description: Cancer that occurs in the prostate gland.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have difficulty or pain during urination?

name: Liver Cancer
description: Cancer that begins in the liver cells.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have persistent upper abdominal pain or yellowing of skin?

name: Pancreatic Cancer
description: Cancer that forms in the pancreas.

assessment_questions.question: Have you experienced unexplained weight loss with abdominal pain?

name: Leukemia
description: Cancer of the blood and bone marrow.

assessment_questions.question: Do you feel unusually tired with frequent infections?

name: Lymphoma
description: Cancer of the lymphatic system.

assessment_questions.question: Have you noticed painless swelling of lymph nodes?

name: Brain Cancer
description: Cancer that begins in the brain tissue.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have persistent headaches or new seizures?

name: Ovarian Cancer
description: Cancer that begins in the ovaries.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience persistent bloating or pelvic discomfort?

name: Cervical Cancer
description: Cancer that develops in the cervix.

assessment_questions.question: Have you experienced abnormal vaginal bleeding?

name: Thyroid Cancer
description: Cancer that develops in the thyroid gland.

assessment_questions.question: Have you noticed a new lump in your neck?

name: Kidney Cancer
description: Cancer that begins in the kidneys.

assessment_questions.question: Have you noticed blood in your urine?

name: Bladder Cancer
description: Cancer that develops in the bladder lining.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have blood in urine or pain while urinating?

name: Oral Cancer
description: Cancer that affects the mouth or throat.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have mouth sores that are not healing?

name: Anemia
description: A condition where the blood lacks enough healthy red blood cells.

assessment_questions.question: Do you feel tired or short of breath with minimal effort?

name: Urinary Tract Infection (UTI)
description: An infection in any part of the urinary system.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience burning sensation while urinating?
